PageTitle: peer preferred-value (BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view)(IPv4)
FuncDef:
The peer preferred-value command sets a preferred value for the routes that a BGP device learns from its peer.
The undo peer preferred-value command deletes the preferred value set for the routes that a BGP device learns from its peer. The peer preferred-value command sets a preferred value for the routes that a BGP device learns from its peer. The undo peer preferred-value command deletes the preferred value set for the routes that a BGP device learns from its peer. By default, the preferred value of a route learned from a BGP peer is 0.
ParentView: BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IPv4 peer address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the preferred value of the routes that a BGP device learns from its peer.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.

ExtraInfo: After a preferred value is configured for a peer, all the routes learned from the peer have the preferred value. If multiple routes with the same prefix are available, the route with the largest preferred value is preferred.
